pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:0.5: 47. The training rule on shaking the hand
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six ate shaking their hands. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.3.1: “‘I will not eat shaking my hand,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.4: One should not eat shaking one’s hand.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats shaking his hand, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.11: if he shakes the hand to discard trash;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.14: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.15: The seventh training rule is finished.
